page.title: 12Trent Water Sports.
page.content: The Trent Valley runs across the south of the area, and many leisure activities are related to the{River {Trent. { Angling}is the most popular partic- ipant sport, both on the river and in the disused gravel pits on each side. {Sailing}and{water-skiing}clubs make extensive use of the river, the level of which is regulated by sluices such as{Holme Sluices.}Many international events are held at the{National Water {Sports Centre}at Holme Pierrepont, which boasts a 2km rowing course, con- structed on the site of old gravel pits, as well as a country park. {Colwick Hall}is now a hotel, and its grounds, too, have become a country park with a nature reserve, a marina and lakes devoted to various water sports.{Nottingham Race Course}is also in{Colwick Park.}
